item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

colorblindr by Claire D. McWhite & Claus O. Wilke üíØ

What is this?

Simulate colorblindness in production-ready R figures to ensure accessibility in visualizations.

  1. Link to repo: https://github.com/clauswilke/colorblindr

  2. Link to simulator: http://hclwizard.org/cvdemulator/

Back to top

Buy me a coffee

correlation: Perform Correlation Analysis

Added Feb 2nd, 2022

What is this?

Performs a correlation analysis with various statistical measures.

  1. Link to package: https://easystats.github.io/correlation/reference/correlation.html
Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

DataEditR by Dillon Hammill üíØ

What is this?

DataEditR is an interactive tool for manual data entry and editing in R. Built on shiny and rhandsontable, it makes filtering and editing data easier, especially for users with limited coding experience.

  1. Link to package: https://dillonhammill.github.io/DataEditR/
Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

ellmer: Chat with Large Language Models üíØ

By Hadley Wickham

Added Thu Feb 20, 2025

What is this?

ellmer is an R package that facilitates interaction with large language models (LLMs) from various providers directly within R. It supports multiple LLM providers, including OpenAI, Anthropic‚Äôs Claude, Google Gemini, and more. Key features of ellmer include streaming outputs, tool/function calling, and structured data extraction, enhancing the integration of LLM capabilities into R workflows.

  1. Link to package here: https://ellmer.tidyverse.org/
Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

esquisse add-in

Added Feb 2nd, 2022

What is this?

An RStudio add-in for interactively exploring and visualizing data with ggplot2. Users can create and export plots with ease.

  1. Link to package: https://github.com/dreamRs/esquisse

  2. Online documentation: https://dreamrs.github.io/esquisse/index.html

Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

fable: Time Series Forecasting Models

What is this?

Fable provides a collection of time series forecasting models that integrate with the tidyverse framework, making model evaluation and visualization straightforward.

  1. Link to package: https://github.com/tidyverts/fable
Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

funneljoin: Time-Based Joins for Event Sequences

What is this?

Analyze behavior funnels by performing time-based joins with funneljoin.

  1. Link to blog: https://hookedondata.org/introducing-the-funneljoin-package/

  2. Link to package: https://github.com/robinsones/funneljoin

grateful: Facilitate Citation of R Packages üíØ

Added Mon Apr 24, 2023

What is this?

grateful makes it easy to cite R and its packages in analyses by generating a BibTeX file of citations for used packages.

  1. Link to package: https://pakillo.github.io/grateful/

parameters: Process Statistical Model Parameters üíØ

What is this?

Provides tools for computing p-values, confidence intervals, Bayesian indices, and variable selection across various statistical models.

  1. Link to package: https://easystats.github.io/parameters/
Back to top

Buy me a coffee

pipediff üíØüíØ [Great for Teaching]

What is this?

Overrides %>% in the caller environment to display differences between pipe steps. Useful for debugging and teaching.

  1. Link to package: https://github.com/moodymudskipper/pipediff

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

session_info: Print Session Information

Added Feb 2nd, 2022

What is this?

Provides detailed session information, useful for debugging and reproducibility.

  1. Link to function: https://rdrr.io/cran/sessioninfo/man/session_info.html

*** What I like to use if I want a list of all packages with an asterisk if I have them in this script: library(sessioninfo)

library(sessioninfo) session_info(pkgs=‚Äú!loaded‚Äù, to_file = TRUE)

** What I like to use for reports and sharing scripts:

library(sessioninfo) session_info(pkgs=‚Äú!attached‚Äù, to_file = TRUE)

Back to top

Buy me a coffee

tidycountries: Access and Manipulate Country-Level Data üíØ

Added Thu Feb 20, 2025

What is this?

Provides country-level data (names, regions, populations, etc.) in a tidy format for easy integration with tidyverse workflows.

  1. Link to package: https://denironyx.github.io/tidycountries/

widyr: Widen, Process, and Re-Tidy a Dataset üíØ

What is this?

Transforms datasets between wide and tidy formats, enabling co-occurrence counts, correlations, and clustering operations.

  1. Link to package: https://github.com/dgrtwo/widyr

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

A gentle crash course in R using tidyverse üå±

By: Nicholas M. Michalak & Loek Brinkman

What is this?

Description from site: In this three-hour workshop, we introduce you to data science in the R programming language. In particular, we‚Äôll show you how to use the ‚Äútidyverse‚Äù package to transform, visualize and model data. The workshop consists of short introductory presentations followed by elaborate hands-on sessions. At the end of each section, we‚Äôll showcase more complex features and functionality. The workshop is designed as an introduction to R. Zero programming experience is required. By the end of the workshop, you‚Äôll have a ‚Äúfeel‚Äù for what R is and what it can do for you, and we‚Äôll provide resources for follow-up self-study.

  1. Course materials here: https://osf.io/69gub/
Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

A Psychologist‚Äôs Guide to R üå±

By: Sean C. Murphy

Added Fri Apr 28, 2023

What is this?

Description from site: This is a repository containing the course notes and worked examples for a six week course in the R statistical programming language taught at the University of Melbourne, Australia. It is targeted at graduate students and faculty in psychology (and probably other social sciences) with no programming experience, and covers the use of R from the basics up to multilevel modelling, though it is not exhaustive within that range.

  1. Course materials here: https://github.com/seanchrismurphy/A-Psychologists-Guide-to-R
Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

Advanced R üå≥üå≥

By Hadley Wickham

What is this?

Excerpt from site: This is the website for 2nd edition of ‚ÄúAdvanced R‚Äù, a book in Chapman & Hall‚Äôs R Series. The book is designed primarily for R users who want to improve their programming skills and understanding of the language. It should also be useful for programmers coming to R from other languages, as it helps you to understand why R works the way it does.

  1. Free web-book here: https://adv-r.hadley.nz/ or http://adv-r.had.co.nz/Introduction.html
  2. Buy book here: Link to Amazon
Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

A-Guided-Tour-of-R üå±

By Sean Chris Murphy

Added Fri April 28th, 2023

What is this?

Description from site: A self-paced version of an introductory R workshop taught at SPSP 2018. Will probably take 4-10 hours to work through, depending on experience and pacing.

  1. Course materials here: https://github.com/seanchrismurphy/A-Guided-Tour-of-R
Back to top

item.title: Hello Quarto
item.dc:creator: Dr. Joscelin Rocha-Hidalgo
item.description:
Buy me a coffee

An Introduction to R üå±

By Alex Douglas, Deon Roos, Francesca Mancini, Ana Couto & David Lusseau

Added Thu Feb 20, 2025

What is this?

An Introduction to R is a comprehensive online book aimed at beginners in R programming. It covers essential topics such as installing R and RStudio, understanding RStudio‚Äôs interface, working with data structures, creating visualizations, and basic programming concepts. The book is structured to provide practical guidance, making it a valuable resource for those new to R.

  1. Link to book here: https://intro2r.com/
Back to top

An Introduction to R With Hockey Data üå±

By Meghan Hall

Updated Mon Feb 24, 2025What is this?Excerpt from site: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll go through the steps of downloading and setting up R and then, with the use of a sample hockey data set, learn the very basics of R for exploring and visualizing data‚Äù.

  1. Link to slides here: https://meghan.rbind.io/slides/ucsas/hall_ucsas_2021#51

Beginner‚Äôs Guide to Rüå±

A beginner‚Äôs guide to R from Basic R, the world of Tidiverse, to even plotting.
